channel.title: New Firefox 1.5.0.4! HUGE SECURITY UPDATE!
channel.description:
Fixes in Firefox 1.5.0.4
CRITICAL MFSA 2006-43 Privilege escalation using addSelectionListener MFSA 2006-38 Buffer overflow in crypto.signText() MFSA 2006-37 Remote compromise via content-defined setter on object prototypes MFSA 2006-35 Privilege escalation through XUL persist MFSA 2006-32 Fixes for crashes with potential memory corruption
HIGH MFSA 2006-42 Web site XSS using BOM on UTF-8 pages MFSA 2006-41 File stealing by changing input type (variant) MFSA 2006-33 HTTP response smuggling
MODERATE MFSA 2006-36 PLUGINSPAGE privileged JavaScript execution 2 MFSA 2006-34 XSS viewing javascript: frames or images from context menu MFSA 2006-31 EvalInSandbox escape (Proxy Autoconfig, Greasemonkey)
LOW MFSA 2006-39 "View Image" local resource linking (Windows)
To read about each bug go to the source link. Source: http://www.mozilla.org/projects/security/known-vulnerabilities.html#firefox1.5.0.4
Phew. A lot of security updates. Internet explorer still has so many javascript holes lol, so easy to view other people's files and everything. Firefox is the best! :)
~Ron

@Ron wrote:

lol so reinstall the shockwave plugin.

I have it set to do updates automatically too.

item.title: New Firefox 1.5.0.4! HUGE SECURITY UPDATE!
item.dc:creator: @Exernet Exernet
item.description:
@Exernet wrote:

[quote=“PaulT, post:2, topic:3536”]Eh, I haven’t updated my firefox since I first got it, and other than it annoying me to update, haven’t had any problems ;).[/quote]How’s it annoying? It updates in less than a minute, reload browser and you’re done…

item.title: New Firefox 1.5.0.4! HUGE SECURITY UPDATE!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Fixes in Firefox 1.5.0.4

CRITICAL
MFSA 2006-43 Privilege escalation using addSelectionListener
MFSA 2006-38 Buffer overflow in crypto.signText()
MFSA 2006-37 Remote compromise via content-defined setter on object prototypes
MFSA 2006-35 Privilege escalation through XUL persist
MFSA 2006-32 Fixes for crashes with potential memory corruption

HIGH
MFSA 2006-42 Web site XSS using BOM on UTF-8 pages
MFSA 2006-41 File stealing by changing input type (variant)
MFSA 2006-33 HTTP response smuggling

MODERATE
MFSA 2006-36 PLUGINSPAGE privileged JavaScript execution 2
MFSA 2006-34 XSS viewing javascript: frames or images from context menu
MFSA 2006-31 EvalInSandbox escape (Proxy Autoconfig, Greasemonkey)

LOW
MFSA 2006-39 “View Image” local resource linking (Windows)

To read about each bug go to the source link.
Source: http://www.mozilla.org/projects/security/known-vulnerabilities.html#firefox1.5.0.4

Phew. A lot of security updates. Internet explorer still has so many javascript holes lol, so easy to view other people’s files and everything. Firefox is the best!

~Ron
